context.title: Double Box
context.description:
The Double Box cipher is a digraph substitution technique, which works basically like the well-known Playfair algorithm (replacing each letter pair with another), but introduces several improvements, like double encryption and splitting of plaintext.
The Double box cipher was used by the German forces in World War II and was broken in Bletchley Park until 1944.
